channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Novo and Lilly contender Zealand Pharma heralds its obesity drug alternative: It's our 'crown jewel'
item.description: Danish biotech Zealand Pharma is targeting the "next generation" of weight loss drugs as competitors pile into a market dominated by heavyweights Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.

item.title: China’s ‘whatever it takes’ moment? Investors hope for hundreds of billions in new stimulus
item.description: Investors are on tenterhooks as Beijing prepares to deliver fresh policies to boost its economy.

item.title: Global trade at risk as tensions escalate in South China Sea
item.description: Rising naval tensions in the South China Sea are increasingly posing risks to some of the world’s most vital shipping lanes, experts warn.

item.title: Salesforce's UK chief urges government not to regulate all AI companies in the same way
item.description: Salesforce's CEO of U.K. and Ireland told CNBC the firm takes all legislation "seriously" but wants anticipated regulations to be "proportional and tailored."

item.title: UK economy returns to growth as Labour tees up all-important budget
item.description: The U.K. economy returned to growth in August following two consecutive months of stagnation, providing a slight boost for the Labour government.

item.title: How Russia's war economy and defense spending could actually make it weaker
item.description: Russia's war-orientated economy and military spending plans risk deepening major imbalances within the government's finances, analysts say.

item.title: Elon Musk hypes $30,000 Tesla self-driving Cybercab and larger Robovan at robotaxi event
item.description: Tesla's long-awaited robotaxi event started almost an hour late on Thursday and included more big promises from Elon Musk.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Is China's stock market rally behind Indian equity losses?
item.description: China's CSI 300 index has gained about 25% since the stimulus measures were announced, while India's Nifty 50 has fallen by more than 3.5%. Will that continue?

item.title: Tributes pour in for Ratan Tata from industry titans and politicians
item.description: Tata is credited with taking his business house global via several high-profile acquisitions including that of Jaguar-Land Rover in 2008.

item.title: AMD launches AI chip to rival Nvidia's Blackwell
item.description: Advanced generative AI such as OpenAI's ChatGPT requires massive data centers full of GPUs, which has created demand for more companies to provide AI chips.

item.title: Bank of Korea cuts interest rates after holding for almost two years
item.description: The BOK cut its benchmark interest rate from 3.5% to 3.25% after a “clear trend of stabilization” with inflation.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase is set to report third-quarter earnings – here's what the Street expects
item.description: JPMorgan will be watched closely for clues on how banks are faring at the start of the Federal Reserve's easing cycle.

item.title: Grab CEO Anthony Tan gives his no. 1 piece of advice for aspiring entrepreneurs
item.description: He is the head honcho of one of Southeast Asia's biggest tech companies, Grab — but he'll be the first to say that the journey has not been easy.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Is higher-than-expected CPI just a 'janky' data point?
item.description: It’s important to see whether individual data points cohere into a larger pattern, or if they’re just “janky,” as Atlanta Fed President Raphael Bostic put it.

item.title: Tesla robotaxi event comes after a decade of unfulfilled promises from Elon Musk
item.description: Tesla’s robotaxi event on Thursday will test investors faith in Elon Musk’s vision

item.title: The Fed is finally cutting rates, but banks aren't in the clear just yet
item.description: When the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark rate by half a percentage point last month, it boosted prospects for many banks.

item.title: Berkshire slashes Bank of America stake to under 10%, no longer required to disclose frequently
item.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in Bank of America below an important level.

item.title: TD Bank pleads guilty in money laundering case, will pay $3 billion in penalties
item.description: The Department of Justice reportedly was investigating how drug traffickers used TD Bank to launder money derived from fentanyl sales in the U.S.

item.title: Zuckerberg's metaverse is finally showing signs of life, but it's not from VR
item.description: The company formerly known as Facebook appears to have found its footing in virtual and augmented reality through a different medium.

item.title: From day-one parental leave to zero-hours reform, UK workers to gain raft of rights in flagship Labour bill
item.description: Workers will be allowed to take bereavement leave from day one, while pregnant women and new mothers will gain stronger protections against dismissal.

item.title: 7-Eleven's parent company cuts full-year earnings forecast, presses ahead with restructuring
item.description: The news comes as the Japanese retail group resists a takeover attempt by Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard.

item.title: Airbus monthly deliveries fall, piling pressure on annual target as production woes persist
item.description: "Reaching year end delivery guidance will be challenging, but not impossible," analysts at Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Inflation rate hit 2.4% in September, topping expectations; jobless claims highest since August 2023
item.description: The consumer price index was expected to show a 0.1% increase in September and a 2.3% gain from a year ago, according to Dow Jones consensus estimates.

item.title: Microsoft announces new AI tools to help ease workload for doctors and nurses
item.description: Microsoft announced a series of new health-care data and AI tools for clinicians on Thursday.

item.title: Wealthy millennials and Gen Z are redefining philanthropy
item.description: Wealthy donors under the age of 43 are more likely to volunteer, fundraise and act as mentors for charitable causes rather than just give money.

item.title: Why the U.S. government is investigating Google
item.description: A series of complaints say Google's dominant behavior in the online search, advertising, and web applications markets is violating antitrust laws.

item.title: Left and right prey on weak French government as it prepares 'austerity' budget
item.description: France's new and already beleaguered government is to present its 2025 budget Thursday amid an ongoing fiscal crisis for the euro zone's second-largest economy.

item.title: Ripple launches new crypto storage services for banks, fintechs in bid to diversify
item.description: Ripple said it is launching a slew of features aimed at helping banks and fintechs store digital tokens — as part of a broader push into crypto custody.

item.title: Delta sales guidance disappoints, CEO says airline expects lower demand around the election
item.description: Delta Air Lines expects to grow earnings in the fourth quarter, thanks to resilient travel demand and strong bookings for year-end holidays.

item.title: Pfizer threatened to sue renegade executives prior to activist schism, Starboard's Smith says
item.description: Starboard's Jeff Smith called on the company to assemble a special committee to investigate the matter, describing it as "flagrantly unethical."
